title: Two more Conservative by-election defeats: what does it all mean?
description: This episode of Never Mind The Bar Charts is another special with the Lib Dem Pod team, discussing what to make of the latest by-elections

title: Greenbank Crossroads to be closed for resurfacing
description: "The final carriageway resurfacing at the junction of Greenbank Terrace and Greenbank Crescent will take place over a period of 5 nights from Monday 26th February. The road will be closed to traffic from 7pm each evening through to 6am the following morning.

title: Sunak must embrace traditional Conservative values for Tories to win election, poll suggests
description: Poll likely to fuel concerns over Rishi Sunak’s leadership as Labour leads with 22 percentage points over Conservatives

title: Hospital tooth extractions for Wiltshire children way above national average
description: Data released by the Office for Health Improvement and Disparities has shown that rate of children in Wiltshire attending hospital for tooth extractions is 70% higher than the national average.

title: MP says speeding driver who killed two sisters not given tough enough sentence
description: A reckless driver who killed two young sisters on a Somerset road was jailed for only ten years, sparking outrage from their family and their MP

title: Friend or foe? The Conservative Party misjudges Nigel Farage at its peril
description: As they are busy engaging with Nigel Farage, are Conservatives misreading the very threat that he poses to their party.

title: Rishi Sunak urges Right to come together after by-election losses
description: And if they are defeated in both Wellingborough and Kingswood, it would be the third time that two by-elections have been lost on the same day during Rishi Sunak’s premiership. The Tory majority in Kingswood is 11,200, while Wellingborough has a majority of 18,540.

title: There’s only one viable Plan B for the Democrats to beat Trump
description: Still, according to Politico, there might be a path that allows Biden to stand down with dignity and pass on the baton: the Democratic primary campaign is allowed to run its course until 4 June. Biden emerges victorious, with far more than the 1,968 pledged delegate votes needed for the nomination.

title: CLA poll finds labour takes lead among rural voters
description: LABOUR has taken a narrow lead over the Conservatives among England’s rural voters, a poll has found. But while the survey suggests Conservative support has collapsed in the party’s heartlands, the head of a major countryside business association said rural voters were still “politically homeless”.

title: Thames Valley burglaries only solved in 1/4 of cases
description: Only 14 per cent of burglaries in Oxfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Berkshire are solved by Thames Valley Police, according to Home Office figures.

title: Wellingborough by-election: Five things we learned
description: The dust has settled, 30,000-odd votes have been counted and Wellingborough has a new MP. The election was called after a recall petition ousted the former member Peter Bone, whose partner was chosen as the Conservative candidate. But what have we learned during the Northamptonshire constituency's by-election?

title: Green reflections on the budget proposals – what’s in there for climate and nature?
description: Convener of the Green group of Councillors in City of Edinburgh Council. He is the group spokesperson for Climate and Environment. Given the key role Greens played in last

title: Council urged to ditch debt collectors who add 'fear and stress' over unpaid bills
description: Coun Jilly Julian, cabinet member for finance and resources at Stockport council, said: "Liberal Democrats oppose council tax in principle because it is an unfair and regressive taxation model. But, along with business rates, it forms a significant part of ...

title: Lib Dem quits over 'offensive' social media posts
description: Complaints were made after Joyce Onstad reshared a series of posts on X A woman who was expected to become the next Liberal Democrat parliamentary candidate for Southend West in Essex, was suspended from the party and later resigned over what she called ...

title: Here’s what the by-election results mean for the Tory and Labour parties
description: The Liberal Democrats overturned Dame Cheryl’s 16,223 majority to win the seat on a huge swing of 25.2 percentage points, with party leader Sir Ed Davey celebrating by using a yellow hammer to demolish a “blue wall” of model bricks. 2. North ...

title: Map shows every constituency the Tories have lost since 2019
description: In a by-election prompted by the resignation of Tory MP Owen Paterson after he breached House of Commons rules by engaging in paid lobbying, the Liberal Democrats achieved another stunning result: overturning a majority of 22,949 with an even bigger swing ...

title: Alexei Navalny death latest: Russia accused of hiding opposition leader’s body to ‘cover traces of murder’
description: This is proof of Putin’s brutality,’ says US president, as UK minister says it was murder, after activist dies at age 47 in Arctic prison

title: Jagmeet Singh urging Liberals to cover contraceptives for all Canadians
description: New Democrat Leader Jagmeet Singh has reiterated his promise that the confidence-and-supply agreement with the Liberals could fall apart by March 1st.

title: Bill Maher cheers Dem in NY special election: 'Successfully flipped immigration issue,' 'ran to the right'
description: HBO host Bill Maher took a victory lap following the New York special election, insisting it's proof that Democrats have "successfully flipped the immigration issue" on Republicans.

title: Former German spy chief founds new right-wing party
description: A former German spy chief who was sacked after being accused of averting his eyes to the threat posed by the far-right founded a new right-wing party on Saturday, holding an inaugural party congress on a boat near Germany's old capital Bonn.

title: Biden’s gas export pause scrambles the DC energy debate
description: Democrats praise the president's freeze on new natural gas exports as a victory for U.S. consumers. Republicans warn it will harm the fight against climate change.

title: Murray Mandryk: Ottawa follies may provide the distraction Moe needs
description: Well, it seems helpful to Scott Moe and the Sask. Party, who welcome such distractions. Murray Mandryk is the political columnist for the Regina Leader-Post and the Saskatoon StarPhoenix.

title: Is it time for the Liberals and NDP to break up?
description: Within a matter of days, that deal will either collapse or carry on — depending on whether the two sides can come to some kind of agreement to bring pharmacare

title: There are still several turning points on Kallas' road to Brussels
description: Prime Minister Kaja Kallas (Reform) may leave for an EU leadership role, but a few hurdles remain. Most analysts who spoke to ERR said Kallas should run for the European Parliament to boost her ALDE nomination.

title: Emergency contraceptives like morning-after pill must be covered by pharmacare: NDP
description: Every Canadian with a health card should be able to get free birth control and morning-after pills to ensure people have the right to do what they want with their body, federal New Democrat Leader Jagmeet Singh says.

title: ‘Whites are psychopaths,’ DEI ‘scholar’ claims in lecture at UCSF
description: A so-called DEI scholar, Dante King, gave a speech at the University of California San Francisco, during which said that "whites are psychopaths."

title: Rail Action Committee appeal to German railway workers: Stop the military transports! No weapons for the war in Ukraine and the genocide in Gaza!
description: The increase in such transports is the result of the insane pro-war policy of the coalition government of the Social Democrats (SPD), Greens and Liberal Democrats (FDP). We call on all workers to act against the transports.

title: Democrats Have Been Panicking Over Biden’s Age for Years

title: Prominent NYT Columnist Tells Biden To Step Aside: ‘He Is Not Up For This’
